1.description: These weak words are likely to introduce ambiguity.
1.title: Weak

1.description: A sequence of more than two consecutive nouns may have more than one interpretation depending on the possible associations between the words.
1.title: Ambiguous Compound Nouns

1.description: A nominalization means the use of the noun form of a verb which may lead to loss of information about the nominalized action(subject, time, location).
1.title: Ambiguous Nominalization

29.description: Property definitions should be explicit. Thus it is bad practice to define a system's property by comparing it to another system.
29.title: Comparative Adverb

29.description: Following an adjective by two nouns joint by 'and' or 'or' makes it unclear if the adjective describes the first noun only or both nouns.
29.title: Coordination of two nouns modified by an adjective

29.description: Following two verbs joint by 'and' or 'or' by a noun makes it unclear if the noun describes the second verb only or both verbs.
29.title: Coordination of two verbs followed by a noun
